1348717365547118594.text: (6/6) Thank you for your heroism, let’s keep our promise to #BacktheBlue.

1348717364368572418.text: (5/6) We have a lot of work to do to get to the bottom of the events that occurred on Jan. 6, but one priority for me is making sure law enforcement officers who bravely kept us safe get the mental health resources they need to process what happened to them and their colleagues.

1348717363252908039.text: (4/6) We can’t have folks fighting against defunding the police with one hand and on the other strike them with American flags and fire extinguishers.

1348717362091085827.text: (3/6) I stood up against anarchy this summer when our small businesses were burned and looted and officers were harmed. And I stand up against the violent mob who attacked our Capitol last week.

1348717360899829761.text: (2/6) The attack on our Capitol displayed horrendous acts of violence against these men and women in uniform. We can and must do better.

1348717359490596864.text: (1/6) Our nation’s law enforcement officers—from Capitol Police to local deputies—put their lives on the line every day to protect our nation, our communities, our children, and our families. I am proud to Back the Blue.

I served in uniform to defend the right to peaceful protest.

What’s happening at the Capitol right now is not peaceful nor a protest. It’s anarchy, & a betrayal of the American ideals we all hold dear. 

My staff and I are safe.

Thanks to Capitol Police for your selfless work.

1291432349335523328.text: Iowans should be able to access information about the costs associated with their health care in advance, so that they can make the best decisions for themselves and their families. I'm working to make that happen. https://t.co/P3oLQESMnz

1291392928666079233.text: I intend to fulfill that promise to Sarah’s loving parents – Michelle Root and Scott Root – the promise that I will do everything I can to ensure that not one more parent has to go through what the Roots have faced…the loss of both their daughter and the promise of justice.

1291392795178147842.text: This bill isn’t about the southern border or the wall or visa numbers or the larger immigration debate at all…this bill is about changing the system for the better and ensuring that families have the promise of justice.

1291392584175280128.text: Despite provisions of Sarah’s Law being put in place by executive order, it is critical that the Senate codify these enforcement priorities, so that they cannot be removed by future administrations.

1291392489526616064.text: Here’s a bit of good news: President Trump implemented parts of Sarah’s Law through an executive order in 2017, including directing the Secretary of Homeland Security to prioritize the removal of violent criminals.

1291392358337183745.text: Sarah’s Law is about as commonsense a reform as there is. It recognizes the simple fact that all criminals should be held accountable for their actions, and not simply allowed to slip back into the shadows.

1291392247053914115.text: Sarah’s Law is simple: it requires that ICE take custody of a person who is in the country illegally if they are charged w/ a crime that seriously injures another person.

1291392182839058438.text: Today, I rise to call upon my Senate colleagues to end this senseless madness. To do something and stop another tragedy like this from happening with a simple and clean fix. I am asking the Senate to join 26 of their colleagues and pass my bill, Sarah’s Law.

1291392028585209856.text: Sadly, what happened to Sarah is not an isolated incident. We have seen this story play out time and time again in the more than four years since Sarah’s killing. Innocent lives taken by criminals that entered the U.S. illegally through a porous border—but nothing ever changes.

1291391791334404097.text: Mejia posted bond, was released, and disappeared. Still, more than 4 years later, he remains a fugitive – denying Sarah’s loved ones any sense of justice or closure. As a mother, I cannot fathom the grief that her family and friends continue to feel after such a devastating loss.

1291391662627999754.text: Despite repeated requests by local law enforcement, Immigration and Customs Enforcement failed to detain Mejia because of a nonsensical policy that allows ICE to use discretion when determining whether to detain a criminal alien charged with a violent offense.

1291391556495257600.text:
In Iowa, we’ve learned this in a very tragic way. 

On January 31st, 2016 – the same day as her college graduation – Sarah Root was killed by an illegal immigrant named Edwin Mejia. He was drag racing with a blood alcohol level more than three times the legal limit.

1291391378518409216.text: Democrat or Republican, Conservative or Liberal…we know our immigration system is broken…that’s an easy statement to make, but nothing ever changes and we need to start getting things done.

1291391113815887874.text: SOON ➡️ I will speak on the floor to request that the Senate call up & pass my commonsense immigration reform bill – Sarah’s Law – that requires fed law enforcement to detain illegal immigrants who've killed or seriously injured another person. https://t.co/yoosX64CMe

1278383861454553089.text: This trade deal preserves our duty-free access to Mexican and Canadian markets, which many of our ag producers and manufacturers benefit from.

1278383800947441665.text: Having the USMCA in place means certainty. Certainty in a time where prices have been low and markets have been eroded from other trade negotiations.

1278383703337689088.text: This deal will allow those numbers to grow exponentially by creating new export opportunities for our dairy industry, greater access for our egg producers, and reducing non-tariff trade barriers that previously hampered our exporting abilities.

1278383610039582720.text: Canada and Mexico being two of our biggest trading partners, the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement—the USMCA—is a HUGE deal for the state of Iowa.

1278383516833796097.text: Over 87,000 farms make Iowa our nation’s top egg, pork, corn, soybean, and ethanol producer.

1278383227380666370.text: Why is this important? Because, in the great state of Iowa, one out of every five jobs is tied to trade.
